name: wpCJ Chimp
author: Williams Castillo

sections.description: wpCJ Chimp allows you to automatically add a new registered user to your MailChimp list once they registered with your blog depending on his/her selection.
sections.installation:
The easiest way to install it is using the WordPress build-in installation feature:

  • Look for wpCJ Chimp
  • Click on Install
  • Then click on Activate

If you prefer to use the old fashion way then:

  • Download the plugin zip file,
  • Uncompress it anywhere in your hard disk and then
  • Upload it to your plugin directory.
  • Visit the Plugins page of your WordPress installation,
  • Locate wpCJ Chimp in the plugin list and * Click on Activate.

Once you have activate it, a new option is added to your WordPress Settings module named wpCJ Chimp.

Click on the build-in Help link at the WordPress header for configuration and usage.
sections.changelog:
1.0

  • Release date: March 26th, 2010
  • First public release

1.1

  • Release date: March 27th, 2010
  • Merge Vars and Interest Groups are now fetched from MailChimp so there no need to enter the MailChimp Embed Signup form anymore.
  • Mandatory Fields are now verified before the user could get subscribed to the blog or the list.
  • Country in Address fields are now correctly saved to MailChimp.
  • Multichoice and Dropdown fields are now well interpreted.

1.2

  • Release date: April 8th, 2010
  • Improved UI
  • Some minor bugs solved
